file_content.text: We've cleared the blast, my lord. The fortress of the Hand is no more.
The Emperor's will is done.
You performed admirably, Wrath. If only you'd arrived sooner, Gnost-Dural may have never escaped with the Hand.
I'll hunt down Gnost-Dural and reunite you with your fellow servants.
The Hand will be reforged.
The hunt will prove challenging.
We broke armies, saved the Voice, and took down two Dark Council members.
What Pierce means to say is, we are equipped for any challenge that lies before us.
Join me in my chambers, and I'll make you forget all about the Hand.
[Flirt] I can ease your worry.
You can offer me no comfort, Wrath.
Enjoy your freedom, servant. Stop acting like a repressed Jedi.
Give her a break, Jaesa. She's probably exhausted.
Don't worry. We'll find your friends. But first, you should get some rest.
My ship and crew are at your disposal, Servant Twelve.
Welcome aboard.
Captain Malavai Quinn, at your service. This is Lieutenant Pierce, Jaesa Willsaam, Vette and our faithful Talz, Broonmark.
Salutation: I am HK-51. The factotum droid 2V-R8 will see to your needs.
And I am 2V-R8, factotum droid. Your comfort is my utmost priority.
We can share bunk space. You don't snore, do you?
I have no need for rest.
My duty was to protect the Emperor's Voice, not coddle the Hand.
Don't you dare blame me.
I assign no blame, Wrath. Gnost-Dural clearly timed his assault to ensure you were far from the battle.
Fool Jedi figured we'd die on Ziost.
Sith clan ravages Gnost-Dural's plans.
Your minions appear enthusiastic, Wrath. But are they loyal to the Emperor?
Every one of us bows to the Emperor's supremacy.
We all serve the Emperor.
As it should be. Only the devoted will survive the coming storm.
I trust my crew with my life, Servant Twelve--as should you. That's the only loyalty that matters.
They're more than minions.
Yeah. Watch it, missy.
I apologize. We must work together if we are to survive the coming storm.
Your fanatical worship is wearing thin, servant.
Forget the Emperor.
I will strive to temper my devotion.
From a secret enclave, Gnost-Dural orchestrates his Jedi agents to destroy the Emperor. The Hand has tried and failed to discover its location.
Gnost-Dural will take the Hand to this hidden enclave. His ultimate plan remains a mystery, but no one--especially you--can afford to lose the Emperor's servants.
Quinn, alert the Imperial armada to scour the galaxy for Gnost-Dural. Anyone who locates the Jedi's enclave will be rewarded by the Emperor himself.
We will find his enclave.
Yes, my lord.
Focus your efforts on the Outer Rim.
We allowed Gnost-Dural's agents to survive the fortress's destruction. Have they returned to their Master's embrace?
Can we track the escaped Jedi?
Several of the Jedi ships fled to the Outer Rim, my lord. Beyond that, I can't be certain.
The Outer Rim. Of course.
If Gnost-Dural transmitted data from your fortress, we may be able to pursue the signal.
Can we trace his frequency?
Excellent proposal, Wrath.
The Hand is gone, and the Emperor is fading fast. Nothing can stop the Wrath from rising to rule the Empire.
The Empire is mine to control.
Without the Emperor and his Hand, you have no power base. The Dark Council will eagerly destroy you to reassert its power.
During the attack, Gnost-Dural's apprentice stole vital secrets from our databanks and relayed the encrypted files to Hutt Space.
The data drop is on Sleheyron, a world controlled by the Hutt Cartel. You will either find Gnost-Dural's enclave there, or someone who can lead us to it.
We will pick up Gnost-Dural's trail on Sleheyron.
This is our best lead.
We need the exact planetary coordinates of this data drop. Are you able to track it?
Can you pinpoint its location?
Of course, Wrath. Excuse me while I consult my data. I will prepare a full report by the time we reach Sleheyron.
Gnost-Dural may have sent the transmission to lure us into an ambush.
Could be a trap.
Even a snare may lead us to the elusive Jedi.
Excuse me while I track the coordinates of the data drop. I will know more by the time we reach Sleheyron.
She's moving in?
I don't like her running loose on your ship, master. Why don't we lock Servant Twelve in the cargo hold until we need her?
Are you worried I'll trade you in for a pureblood woman?
[Flirt] Jealous?
Hardly. She couldn't handle you if she tried.
Remain watchful.
Master, is it wise to let Servant Twelve operate on your ship? She clearly has no concern for anyone but the Emperor.
Servant Twelve is second only to my authority. If she requests something of you, do it.
Obey her as you would me.
As you wish, master.
Toovee, monitor Servant Twelve's activity on our networks. Everyone else, be vigilant.
Remain watchful.
I will scan her every move, master.
Prepare for Sleheyron, and leave Servant Twelve to me.
Not another word.
Coordinates for Sleheyron are set. We should make haste before Gnost-Dural's trail runs cold.
Reassurance: I will assist 2V-R8 and report on her every movement, master.
You don't know what you're missing, servant.
Perhaps.
Join our mission to Sleheyron. I require your expertise, and your company.
[Flirt] Come with me.
I am familiar with remote operations, but Sleheyron should prove an interesting change of pace.
If you insist, master.
I bet you're a big hit at the Emperor's parties.
Make yourself at home. There's a cozy corner in the engine room with your name on it.
Are you afraid she'll distract me from my favorite apprentice?
[Flirt] Jealous?
On the contrary, master. I savor the competition.
How much data did she seize?
Millions of fragments--a small fraction of the Hand's knowledge, but enough to exceed the storage capacity of Gnost-Dural's ship. Tracking now....
Extrapolation: We will also be exposed to Master Gnost-Dural's inevitable retaliation.
And if we are vulnerable, Master Gnost-Dural will surely target us next!
Survival demands we rescue the Hand at once.
